condition.p: bottom lefthand corner is broken off and lost, and a fragment lighter in color, broken off the bottom of the slab to the left of center, survives; one iron nail is still in place at the center of the righthand side, while on the left only a drill hole remains

decoNote.p: undulating border incised around text; sunken triangles at corners create tabula ansata motif

div.ab:
Dis Manibus
Luci Gavi Amaranti.
Claudia uxor
viro suo bene merenti fecit.

div.p: "To the Shades of the Underworld of Lucius Gavius Amarantus. Claudia, his wife, made (this) for her well-deserving husband."

The modules and spacing between letters are inconsistent, as though the inscriber ran out of space. In particular, the first and last characters of line 2, an 'L' and an 'I' are not equidistant to the border, suggesting that the lettering was inscribed after the border. Note also the uneven spacing of the word 'Manibus' on line 1.
